results.title: Crush
results.creator_credit: Alison MacLean, Bridget Ikin and Hibiscus Films
results.brief_description: Alison Maclean’s (“Kitchen sink”, “Jesus’ son”) debut feature is a macabre psychological study of obsession, sexual jealousy and female friendships. Marcia Gay Harden stars as the brazen and destructive Lane, a classic femme fatale archetype who finds herself stuck in the sleepy New Zealand town of Rotorua after she and her girlfriend Christina (Donogh Rees) are involved in a near fatal car accident. Lane walks away from the crash site unharmed, leaving her friend for dead and lands on the doorstep of the shy and tomboyish Angela (Caitlin Bossley) and her novelist father Colin (William Zappa). The awkward teen soon develops a crush on the more sexually confident Lane, who in turn makes a play for Angela’s father, leaving the abandoned girl devastated and thirsty for revenge. Maclean uses the shifting power plays as an astute metaphor for New Zealand’s own confused relationship to cultural identity, shrewdly casting an American as the self assured and opportunistic outsider, while setting the film in the mainly Maori community of Rotorua. Cast also includes Peter Smith and Jon Brazier.

results.title: Crown of righteousness
results.creator_credit: Norman Walker, Ray Hoke and GHW Production
results.brief_description: Paul’s captivity in Rome. Ephroditus bring him gifts from the Church in Phillippi. A reconstruction of the events relation to St Paul’s re-arrest and hie trial before Nero (2 Timothy IV 7-8).

results.title: Crow boy
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A shy boy attending a village school in Japan withdraws into a world of his own until a kind and wise teacher draws him out and his classmates discover his special talent. Based on the book of the same title by Taro Yashima.

results.title: Critical incidents and trauma: promoting recovery through effective management (for managers)
results.creator_credit: Simon Barnett and Harcroft Consulting Group
results.brief_description: A video training package (with facilitator’s manual) designed to assist managers and supervisors in their vital role of achieving effective management of critical incidents in the workplace. A critical incident is a traumatic event or situation, such as an attack, accident or natural disaster that could have long-term negative effects on those involved. This video package demonstrates how sensitive responses and appropriate interventions from management, both in the immediate aftermath of the incident and in the weeks to follow, can accelerate recovery time and enhance staff morale. See also ‘Critical incidents and trauma: response and recovery for staff’ (310860).

results.title: Crisis over Cuba
results.creator_credit: Brian Blake and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “History in action”.
On 29th August 1962, American Intelligence sources indicated that missile sites had been established in Cuba. The weapons observed were identified as surface to air missiles of a defensive nature and were thus dismissed by US authorities as insignificant. Six weeks later, US spy planes took photographs of what appeared to be launch pads for long-range missiles and it was confirmed that the Soviet Union had placed offensive missiles in Cuba, capable of attacking the United States. The Cuban Missile Crisis had begun.

results.title: Crime: senior alert
results.creator_credit: Ronald Floethe, Gordon Kerkhoff and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Crime against the elderly is on the increase. This film offers sensible information which, if followed, will help protect them against the potential criminal. Gives tips on preventing residential burglary, purse snatchers, developing safe car habits and avoiding high-risk areas.

results.title: Crime and the criminal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Themes of Literature”.
Edited from Richard Brooks’ film ‘In Cold Blood’, an adaptation of Truman Capote’s novel which explores the inner life of a criminal. A sensitive probe into the factors that may have created the criminal, considering how is different from the rest of society and questions the use of the death penalty.

results.title: Crew roles and responsibilities
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode focuses on the camera crew - who’s who and how they do their jobs. The size of the video crew depends on the size of the story to be presented, but there are three essential crew members - the presenter, the sound recordist and the camera operator. The role of each of these in the production of a video story is thoroughly examined.

results.title: Credits included: a video in red and green
results.brief_description: This experimental documentary exhibits the rise of the sublime architecture of shattered shop signs and bricks in war-torn Beirut, creating poignant juxtapositions of progress, beauty and regress. As the filmmaker drives around the ruins of Beirut he documents, amid the chaos and the ruins, signs of life. Toufic films the inmates of the Fanar Mental Hospital; disabled adult men, living in a decrepit institution - a reflection on the forgotten underclass of any society that is torn asunder by war. He then interviews a Lebanese man who is enraged by the injustices that he sees committed around him, identifying himself as a messenger of the prophet Mohammed and Jesus Christ. Finally Toufic ponders the future - what is the destiny of Lebanese children growing up amid conflict; these children display hope and joy as they play, exhibiting innocence. Jalal Toufic is a writer, film theorist, and video artist. This work, “Credits Included: A Video in Red and Green” addresses issues of being a refugee, of displaced persons, of homelessness and destruction. In English and Arabic with English subtitles.
